original: Hagström, Paul Gottfrid, provinsialläkare, Skövde, f. 8/4/94 i Tillberga, Västmanl. 1., av fodkskoll. Johan Gottfrid H. o. Augusta Maria Berner. G. 24 m. Valborg Eker. Barn: Birgitta f. 24, Bertil 28, Gunilla 35. — Stud:-ex. 13, med. kand. 17 o. med. Hc. 23 i Upps. Tjg. v. Bodens garn:sjukh. 19-20, tf. hitr. läk. v. Vänersb. hosp. 21, assist :läk. v. Akad. sjukh. med. avd. sju mån. 22-24, aman. v. med. o. pe-diatr. poliklin. i Upps. 23-24, assist :-;läk. v. bröst- o. barnavd. 24, läk. v. underst :byrån f. tub. i Upps. 23-24, v. pedag. skoian där, bitr. läk. v. Epid:- sjukh. 24-25, e. prov :läk. i Väddö distr. 25-29, däk. v. Sthlms 1. folkhögsk. i Väddö 25-29, v. Väddö komm. sinnes-sjukanst. 28-29, prov :läk. i Skövde distr. sed. 29, skolläk. v. Skövde h. a. 1., läk. v. Skarab. 1. sjukhem o. Aspö vårdhem i Skövde.
translated: Hagström, Paul Gottfrid, district physician, Skövde, b. 8/4/94 in Tillberga, Västmanland, son of elementary school principal Johan Gottfrid H. and Augusta Maria Berner. Married on 24 May with Valborg Eker. Children: Birgitta b. 1924, Bertil b. 1928, Gunilla b. 1935. — Completed studentexamen (final exam) in 1913, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1917, and a Doctor of Medicine degree in 1923 from Uppsala University. Worked at Boden Garrison Hospital from 1919-1920, temporary district physician at Vänersborg Hospital in 1921, assistant physician in the Medical Department at the Uppsala University Hospital for seven months from 1922-1924, trainee at the Department of Medicine and Pediatrics in Uppsala from 1923-1924, assistant physician in the Department of Chest and Children’s Diseases in 1924, physician at the Tuberculosis Health Bureau in Uppsala and worked as a teaching physician there, deputy physician at the Epidemic Hospital from 1924-1925, district physician in Väddö from 1925-1929, physician at the Stockholm’s First Folk High School in Väddö from 1925-1929, worked at the Väddö Municipal Psychiatric Institution from 1928-1929, was appointed district physician in Skövde in 1929, became the school physician at Skövde Secondary School, and worked as a physician at Skaraborg Hospital and Aspö Nursing Home in Skövde.
